description:
The two men who carried out the first ever successful prison break from a federal maximum security penitentiary in Brazil were captured on Thursday, after spending 60 days on the run.  The prison break was an embarrassment for federal law enforcement and underlined citizens’ perceptions of a security crisis in the country, as crime has […]

The post Brazil captures federal fugitives after 50-day chase appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: Brazil captures federal fugitives after 50-day chase

description:
Lula has been criticized for his government's decision not to hold remembrance for the 1964 coup, which led to a decades-long dictatorship

The post If you lie down with dogs, you get up with fleas appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: If you lie down with dogs, you get up with fleas

description:
A group of Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Thursday sent a public letter to President Joe Biden and Secretary of State Antony Blinken calling for the declassification of 13 documents related to the beginning of Brazil’s 1964-1985 dictatorship. The letter was sent days after the 60th anniversary of the March 31, 1964 coup led by Army […]

The post U.S. lawmakers call for release of more Brazil dictatorship files appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: U.S. lawmakers call for release of more Brazil dictatorship files

description:
Brazil lost 36 percent less primary forest in 2023 than in 2022, according to new data from the University of Maryland’s Global Land Analysis and Discovery (GLAD) lab, published on Thursday. The decline meant that last year saw Brazil hit its lowest level of primary forest loss since 2015. The Amazon experienced the largest decline, […]

The post 2023 forest loss in Brazil lowest for eight years appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
title: 2023 forest loss in Brazil lowest for eight years
